TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi DataGridRow extends System.Windows.Controls.Control

Docs.summary: Represents a row.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> row represents a single data item in a bound data source. Each row contains one cell per column in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid>, and each cell displays a single value in the bound data item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AlternationIndex As Integer
public: property int AlternationIndex { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the row within a set of alternating rows.
Docs.value: The index of the row within a set of alternating rows. The registered default is 0. For information about what can influence the value, see .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Alternating rows are rows to which you can assign different characteristics, such as alternating background colors. You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationCount%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> to indicate the number of rows within a set of alternating rows. For more information about alternating rows, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationCount%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
Override the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.OnPropertyChanged%2A> method to respond to changes to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property does not have its own property changed method because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndexProperty> field reuses the read-only <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationIndexProperty?displayProperty=nameWithType> field.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty AlternationIndexProperty
Public Shared ReadOnly AlternationIndexProperty As DependencyProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndexProperty> field reuses the read-only <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationIndexProperty?displayProperty=nameWithType> field.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Style ^ HeaderStyle { System::Windows::Style ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Style ^ value); };
member this.HeaderStyle : System.Windows.Style with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering the row header.
Docs.value: The style that is used when rendering the row header. The registered default is . For information about what can influence the value, see .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To define a <xref:System.Windows.Style> for a row header, specify a <xref:System.Windows.Style.TargetType%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowHeader>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Style> can be applied to all row headers, or to an individual row header. To apply a <xref:System.Windows.Style> to an individual header set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.HeaderStyle%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, which takes precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.RowHeaderStyle%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnPropertyChanged(valuetype System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnPropertyChanged (e As DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)

Docs.param: The event data that describes the property that changed, as well as old and new values.
Docs.summary: Invoked whenever the effective value of any dependency property on this has been updated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.OnPropertyChanged%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>. The specific dependency property that changed is reported in the arguments parameter.
Override this method to respond to changes to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property does not have its own property changed method because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndexProperty> field reuses the read-only <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationIndexProperty?displayProperty=nameWithType> field.

block.para: Always call the base implementation as the first operation in your implementation. Failure to do this will significantly disable the entire [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] property system, which causes incorrect values to be reported. The specific implementation is also responsible for maintaining the correct state for the property, which affects the visible user interface and invalidates the visual tree based on property value changes at appropriate times.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSelected(class System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnSelected (e As RoutedEventArgs)
abstract member OnSelected : System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs -> unit override this.OnSelected : System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: The event data, which is empty when this method is called by the .
Docs.summary: Raises the event when the property value changes to .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.OnSelected%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, make sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.
